meanings.definition: To make (something) impure or weaker by adding something of inferior quality.
meanings.sent1: She was adulterating the soup by adding too much salt.
meanings.sent2: The chef was caught adulterating the ingredients to save money.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous raccoon was caught adulterating the bird feeder with rocks.
meanings.sent4: The gossip was spreading like wildfire, adulterating the truth with lies.
meanings.sent5: The rain adulterated the purity of the fresh snow, turning it into slush.

meanings.definition: To corrupt, debase, or make impure by adding a foreign or inferior substance.
meanings.sent1: The counterfeit artist was adulterating the paintings with cheap materials.
meanings.sent2: The company was accused of adulterating their products with harmful chemicals.
meanings.sent3: The prankster was caught adulterating the punch with hot sauce.
meanings.sent4: The invasive species was adulterating the ecosystem, disrupting the natural balance.
meanings.sent5: The fake news was adulterating the public's perception of reality.
